author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: عَمَّا قَدَّرْتَةُ لأصْفِيَائِكَ، وَيا إِلهِي إِنِّي حَبَّةٌ قَدْ زَرَعْتَهَا فِي أَرْضِ حُبِّكَ وَأَنْبَتْتَها بِيَدِ إِحْسَانِكَ، إِذًا تَطْلُبُ بِكيْنُونَتِهَا مَاءَ رَحْمَتِكَ وَكَوْثَرَ فَضْلِكَ، فَأَنْزِلْ عَلَيْهَا مِنْ سَمَاءِ عنَايَتِكَ ما يُرَبِّيهَا فِي ظِلِّكَ وَجِوارِكَ، وَإِنَّكَ أَنْتَ ساقِي قُلُوبِ العارِفِينَ مَاءَ الكَوْثَرِ وَالتَّسْنِيمِ وَالحَمْدُ
translation: I am, O my God, but a tiny seed which Thou hast sown in the soil of Thy love, and caused to spring forth by the hand of Thy bounty. This seed craveth, therefore, in its inmost being, for the waters of Thy mercy and the living fountain of Thy grace. Send down upon it, from the heaven of Thy loving-kindness, that which will enable it to flourish beneath Thy shadow and within the borders of Thy court. Thou art He Who watereth the hearts of all that have recognized Thee from Thy plenteous stream and the fountain of Thy living waters.
